document.name: DynamicRelation
document.documentation: Represents a relation - ie a database joining table or foereign key (association or collection). There can be multiple rows with the same attribute name for multiple cardinality relations. The Dynamic Relations are upserted with the same bizId as its static counterpart when there is a mix. So this is manipulated outside of Hibernate O/R mapping.

text.name: relatedModuleName
text.description: Populated with the related document's module name if the dynamic relation is to a static document.

text.name: relatedDocumentName
text.description: Populated with the related document's name if the dynamic relation is to a static document.

id.name: relatedId
id.documentation: This is an ID because it may be related to a static entity. It also makes schema evolution easier as deletes will remove everything related.
id.description: The ID for the related dynamic entity (admin.DynamicEntity) OR a real entity.

text.name: attributeName
text.description: The attribute name of this relation.

integer.name: ordinal
integer.description: Used for ordered collections (akin to bizOrdinal)
